item.title: A Rant on Usable Security
item.description: I recently gave a talk at DevOps Days (slides) and it had a pretty great response. I’m still pretty care-mad about the topics it covered so I figured I would turn some key points from it into a blog post. The overall outline of the talk covered the past, present, and future of usable security. Let’s start with the past. The Past A lot of the security tooling of the past (that we still use today) require users to jump through a lot of hoops or learn a hard to grok interface.
